blocks.name: df-sigagen
blocks.content: Define the sigma-algebra generated by a given collection of sets as the intersection of all sigma-algebra containing that set. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Dec-2016.)

  syl((c0 ∈(sigAlgebra ` ⋃ c1)∧ c1 ⊆ c0), (sigaGen ` c1)= ⋂ { hs0 ∈(sigAlgebra ` ⋃ c1)| c1 ⊆ hs0 }, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  ancoms(c0 ∈(sigAlgebra ` ⋃ c1), c1 ⊆ c0, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  ssexg(c1, c0, (sigAlgebra ` ⋃ c1))
  sigagenval(hs0, c1, universe)
  intminss(hs0, c0, (sigAlgebra ` ⋃ c1), c1 ⊆ c0, c1 ⊆ hs0)
  sseq2(hs0, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((sigAlgebra ` ⋃ c1))
  diff.hs0.w(c1 ⊆ c0)
}
